body_html:
Maybe the bat file? If you name it Note [Backslash munging on Windows] then you can cross-reference it from relevant sites.

BTW, given the comment you gave above, wouldn't another acceptable way to fix the problem, be simply to "escape" strings before we pass them to cmake? That actually would make more sense to me, and be more uniform than trying to squish every path site from Python (I'm sure we've missed some.)
body_text:
Maybe the bat file? If you name it Note [Backslash munging on Windows] then you can cross-reference it from relevant sites.
BTW, given the comment you gave above, wouldn't another acceptable way to fix the problem, be simply to "escape" strings before we pass them to cmake? That actually would make more sense to me, and be more uniform than trying to squish every path site from Python (I'm sure we've missed some.)
body:
Maybe the bat file? If you name it `Note [Backslash munging on Windows]` then you can cross-reference it from relevant sites.

BTW, given the comment you gave above, wouldn't another acceptable way to fix the problem, be simply to "escape" strings before we pass them to cmake? That actually would make more sense to me, and be more uniform than trying to squish every path site from Python (I'm sure we've missed some.)
